intro: Capraria biflora, commonly known as the twin-flowered capraria, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and coastal areas. Its flowers are small, clustered, and often have a violet or purple hue. Capraria biflora is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
